name: On the Beach Holiday Apartments

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can I say about these apartments. This was our third visit here and we never leave disappointed.
reviews.title: most fantastic place

likes.liked: — everything! Am I gushing too much!!

reviews.text: These apartments are spotlessly clean and extremely well maintained. The self catering apartments here are one,two or three bedroomed and fully self contained. There is everything you can think of, washing machine, dryer,ironing board and iron, tv with satellite channels, fully equipped kitchens with toaster, kettle,full cooker,microwave, fridge freezer etc etc etc.. the list is endless.
reviews.title: Absolute Paradise

reviews.text: The decor is bright, tropical and cheerful. Each block of apartments has a pool, jacuzzi and sun terrace area with sunloungers, table and chairs and a gas bbq.
reviews.title: Excellent !

reviews.text: The location is fantastic - literally "on the beach". You are a few steps away from a small local shop which sells basics like bread and milk. Also a few restaurants and eateries are adjacent to the shop. About a 10-15 minute walk is a medium sized supermarket who will give you a lift back to your doorstep free of charge. We had a hire car whilst there and there is a much larger indoor shopping centre at Smithfield about 10 minutes drive away. For those who don't wish to hire a car there is a local bus service Sunbus that runs regularly from Trinity Beach to Cairns and alo up to Port Douglas.
reviews.title: Fantastic in every detail
Loved the Location
reviews.text: The owners Clive and Mary as previous posters have said are fantastic hosts and can give you great advice on the local area and help you choose from the myriad of trips available.

reviews.title: Best Deal on the Beach
reviews.text: I had a wonderful week in Cairns while staying at the "On The Beach Apartments" located at Trinity Beach, just north of downtown Cairns. (49-51 Vasey Esplanade; info@onthebeach.com.au; [-----])

reviews.title: A perfect choice
reviews.text: I found that the Palm Express shuttle service has the best prices to and from the airport.

reviews.title: Decent accomodations, nice quiet beach
reviews.text: Everyone at the front desk was quite knowledgeable and very willing to help you plan your time in Cairns and the Great Barrier Reef. There is tons to choose from, so a stop at the desk is well worth it, as you can book your trips with confidence. In fact, the front desk will book anything you want at no extra fee. The pick up for most activites is at the front desk or a very short walk around the corner to the local bus stop.

reviews.title: Excellent appartments
reviews.text: There are a handful of restaurants within walking distance, a quicky-mart type store at the corner (about one block away) that has basic food/supplies and internet access. There is a 'real' grocery store that is about a 30 minute walk-seems longer when it's raining.... that will drive you and your groceries back to your room. Very nice.

reviews.title: Great place to stay
reviews.text: My apt was clean and comfortable. Having a washer/dryer was great-thought I'd use it once to 'start fresh' as I had already been traveling for two weeks. However, I used it almost every day, as most of my activities involved being wet, in the ocean or in the local river. ( see 'attractions' for a review of my adventures)

The apartments are well located, clean and spacious. They are only serviced once a week. We were only staying three days so it didn't matter to us but if you're staying longer you should be aware. There is also not a full time reception service. If you arrive out of hours you key will be left in a safe outside reception. The apartment was clean and spacious but however hard we tried we couldn't make it cool. The fans are right above the beds so you are constantly in a draft at night and it's too hot to turn them off. We were most disappointed with the attitude of the receptionist who was most unhelpful. We were required to reconfirm our airport transfers in advance, so we asked Reception to do this for us. The Receptionist reluctantly did the one to Cairns airport at a charge but refused to do our Sydney transfer. She told us that it was a freephone number and to do it from our room. We did this and were then horrified to find had been charged to make a free phone call from our room. When my friend complained it was refunded to us. The establishment prides itself on providing an excellent service, not our experience!
reviews.title: A little disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay here was part of our own tour of Australia, The apartment furniture was a little worn. Air Conditioning unit in the bedroom was very loud, we switched it off at night. Tea,coffee etc was provided but after using the initial few provided you had to purchase any extra you might need. So be aware if staying more than a couple of nights. Towels provided a little to skimpy and no toiletries although the pool towels were new and large. It is worth noting that these are only weekly serviced apartments and the reception is only open office hours, reduced at weekends. After reading the brochure description we did not feel it quite hit the mark. The couple that managed the apartments were lovely and certainly went out of their way to make you feel welcome and help in anyway they could.
reviews.title: A bit to be desired

reviews.text: We've just returned form a 4 day stay at on of the beachview appartments. We had beautiful views and the appartment was spacious. The place would be ideal for families if it wasn't for the tiny pool.
reviews.title: Great location but off-season best to book in Australia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Trinity Beach is ok and probably best as a base for those with a car. The beach is not as great as say Port Douglas. We visited outside the Australian school holidays and there weren't many young families (or people below 60 for that matter).
reviews.title: Great Cheap Escape

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In August it seems you're likely to get much better rates when booking direct in Australia and last minute.
reviews.title: perfect spot

reviews.text: A friend and I booked an escape to the tropics through Virgin Blue (which has great deals from Sydney) and we had our choice of many different hotels through their vacation package. We selected On The Beach based on the reviews here. We were extremely pleased with our choice. First, we got a great deal: $470 for flight (Sydney-Cairns return) plus 3 nights accommodation at On The Beach. Second, the location is magnificent. The apartments are located right across the road from the beach and, more importantly during stinger season, they are directly across from the stinger net (the only safe area to swim on the beach). Third, the apartments are spacious, wonderfully set up, and the kitchenette is a great thing to have to cut down on dining costs. Finally, the service is beyond expectations. The owners were extremely nice and hospitable. They recommended a wonderful tour company for exploring the reef (Seastar tours) and they gave us great restaurant tips. They also gave us a tip that the local grocery store (which is about a 20 minute walk away) would drive us back to our hotel for free if we spent over 30 bucks there. Even nicer, we had a late flight and we want to spend the day relaxing on the beach. So, we asked if we could store our luggage. They went beyond this and let us stay in our room well past check out time so that we could come back and shower in our room at the end of the day. They were absolutely wonderful. If you are looking for a relaxing time, I highly recommend this hotel!!!!!!
reviews.title: Great location, great service, great deal.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a 5 night stay at the excellent beachfront location we really didn't want to leave. Our one bedroom apartment was spacious and well equipped with amazing views over the beach.
reviews.title: Excellent Service
More than you can imagine!!
reviews.text: In addition to the great room and location was the service provided by owners Clive and Mary who were very helpful at booking all our trips and excursions in the local area. With so much to see and do in the area and the Great Barrier Reef on the doorstep we were spoilt for choice!

reviews.title: Wonderful Accomodations & Sightseeing Assistance
reviews.text: Overall a great stay and I look forward to returning one day!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want a quiet , beautiful place to stay in Cairns, Australia, this is the place. The accomodations are wonderful---clean, spacious and with lots of pools and a beautiful, safe beach to relax on! However, the best part about this place is the staff! While planning our trip to Cairns from the USA, Mary helped us narrow down the best side trips, booked the trips for us and made sure we had transfers to and from the airport and our local destinations. Planning a trip like this can be overhwhelming with so side many trips to choose from. Mary (and the rest of the staff) took time to explain all of the options (via email) and helped us plan the best trip for our large group. She was more helpful than any travel agent we contacted! Thanks "On the Beach!!"
reviews.title: What can I say - 'Fantastic'

aka: On The Beach Holiday Apartments Hotel Trinity Beach
description: Located directly opposite the patrolled swimming area of beautiful Trinity Beach and within an easy walk to local shops and restaurants, On The Beach Holiday Apartments offers 43 self-contained apartments. We have 1, 2 or 3 Bedrooms each with its own private, ocean facing balcony to capture the cool sea breezes. Apartment types include Beachfront and 2 bedroom Ocean view or Garden view - something for everyone. Stay for a night, a week or a month.
